spell.name: Sciath's Smithing Sigil
entries: You place your unique touchmark on a creature or object that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack.
The first time a creature wearing or made of metal is dealt damage by this spell on your turn, its AC is reduced by 1 until the end of your next turn.
You can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to mark a new creature or object, dispelling the mark on the previous creature or object.
When you cast this spell targeting an object that you're crafting or have crafted, the mark becomes permanent and cannot be dispelled or disguised without your permission.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, the spell's duration becomes concentration, up to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration becomes concentration, up to 8 hours, and the extra damage increases by {@damage 1d6}.

spell.name: Heavenstrike

m.text: a holy symbol devoted to your deity

entries: You beseech your deity to strike down the wicked with a powerful stroke of divine energy. Choose a point you can see within range. A bolt of destructive energy flashes down to that point from the sky, exploding in a flash of intensely bright light and a resounding boom audible up to 10 miles away.

All creatures within a 40-foot radius of the point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 45d6} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This damage is reduced by {@damage 1d6} for every 5 feet the creature is from the center of the explosion.

The damage is either radiant or necrotic (your choice, depending on the alignment of the deity you serve). If you choose radiant damage, {@creature undead|Undead} and {@creature fiends|fiends} have disadvantage on the saving throw. If you choose necrotic damage, {@creature celestials|celestials} and {@creature plants|plants} have disadvantage on the saving throw.

spell.name: Bone Ossification
entries: You point at one creature you can see within range, forcing it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d12} piercing damage as it explodes into bone spikes. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and the spell ends.

If the target fails its save, each creature within 10 feet of it (other than the target) must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d12} piercing damage on a failed save, or no damage on a successful one.
This spell has no effect on creatures without a skeleton.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d12|3-9|1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Boon of Savagery

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entries: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the weapon's type, and you gain 5 temporary hit points.

If you do not make an attack on your next turn, you are driven ravenous on the turn after. While you are ravenous, you must subtract {@dice 1d4} from any ability check or saving throw you make. This effect ends after you make an attack or when combat ends.
This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the extra damage increases to {@damage 2d4}. It increases to {@damage 3d4} at 11th level, and {@damage 4d4} at 17th level.

spell.name: Identify Curse

m.text: a pure quartz crystal worth 1,000gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You choose one object that you must touch throughout the entirety of the spell's casting. If the item is cursed, the crystal used as the material component turns a deep black and crumbles to dust. You learn the basic details of the curse, such as its primary effect and the conditions required for it to be applied to a creature. The DM may describe the curse's effects in figurative language.
If you instead touch a creature for the entire casting time, you learn what curses, if any, are currently affecting it and the primary effect of each curse.

spell.name: Umbral Lance

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You gather shadows from around you into a spear to hurl at a creature that you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. If the target cannot see invisible creatures, this attack is made with advantage. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|1-9|1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Umbral Leech

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: Hungry shadows lash out at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage, and the next creature to hit the target with an attack before the end of your next turn regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage and the healing both increase by {@damage 1d6} for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Echoing Anguish

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You call forth hundreds of wailing shadows to a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage and become {@condition deafened} for the duration. A creature affected by this spell makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer deafened.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d6|2-9|1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Animate Shadow

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You call your shadow forth to fight on your behalf. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the {@creature Animated Shadow|CLDR} stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Shadow Barghest

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You draw nearby shadows to form a wild beast which strikes out against a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} piercing damage and is {@condition restrained} for the duration of the spell. A creature can use its action to make a Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC to free itself.
For the duration, as a bonus action on your turn, you can cause a creature restrained by this spell to take {@damage 3d8} piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d8|3-9|1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Shadow Shrike

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You draw nearby shadows to form around your body. As a bonus action on your turn while this spell is active, you can increase the ranges of your attacks and spells by 30 feet for the rest of the turn. Additionally, for the rest of the turn, you can add {@damage 2d8} psychic damage to one damage roll you make during the turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Shadow Sentinel

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You draw nearby shadows to form around you. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you when you cast this spell becomes bonded to you. While this spell is active, whenever a bonded creature within 30 feet of you takes damage that is not resisted, they take 10 less damage and you lose 10 hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the amount of damage reduced and hit points you lose increases by 5 for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Shadow Seraph

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You draw nearby shadows to form around you. While this spell is active, whenever you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of you regains hit points, you can use your reaction to give that creature a number of temporary hit points equal to the amount of hit points they regained, up to a maximum of 30.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the maximum number of temporary hit points gained increases by 20 for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Shadow Trickster

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You draw nearby shadows to form around your body. Whenever you score a critical hit, or are critically hit by a creature, the target of your attack or the source of the damage against you takes {@damage 2d8} psychic damage and you gain temporary hit points equal to the psychic damage dealt by this effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d8} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Dark Beast

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You congeal the shadows around you into a massive beast. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the {@creature Dark Beast|CLDR} stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Dark Nova

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You draw nearby shadows to form a creature to protect you. While this spell is active, you can add {@damage 1d8} psychic damage to one damage roll of any spell you cast.

When this spell ends, the shadows lash out in a massive wave against one of your enemies. A creature within 60 feet of you must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, the target takes {@damage 10d10} psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt when the spell ends increases by {@scaledamage 10d10|5-9|2d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Dark Fiend

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: While this spell is active, whenever you hit a creature with a spell attack roll, that creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes before the end of this spell's duration.

When this spell ends, a hoard of shadowy hands erupts from a point you can see within 120 feet. Each creature in a 30-foot radius of that point must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 8d6} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage dealt when the spell ends increases by {@scaledamage 8d6|5-9|1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Dark Shepherd

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: While this spell is active, whenever you cause a creature to restore hit points, they gain an additional 10 temporary hit points.

When this spell ends, shadowy blades erupt from you in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must make an Intelligence saving throw, taking {@damage 5d6} psychic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. You gain temporary hit points equal to half the total damage dealt by this effect (maximum 50).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} and the maximum temporary hit points you can gain increases by 10 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Dark Vanguard

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You congeal shadows into a soldier at your command. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the {@creature Dark Vanguard|CLDR} stat block. When you cast the spell, choose Legionnaire, Juggernaut, or Marksman. The creature resembles a soldier of that kind, which determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Abyssal Valkyrie

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You call forth the shadow of a great protector to aid a creature you can see within range. For the spell's duration, the target gains the following benefits:

items: The target gains 10 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns.
The target has half cover.
The target has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries: When this spell ends, the valkyrie leaps away from the target to strike at the nearest foe. The closest hostile creature to the target within 30 feet must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 8d8} piercing damage.

spell.name: Abyssal Shriek

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You unleash the anguish of the shadows as a horrifying scream. Each creature of your choice within 60 feet of you that can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d6} psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} and {@condition deafened} for the duration. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't frightened or deafened.
A creature affected by this spell repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer frightened and deafened.
For the duration, each creature affected by this spell takes {@damage 6d6} psychic damage at the start of its turn.

spell.name: Azala's Branding Burn
entries: You hurl a roaring ball of flame at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d12} fire damage and is seared with fiery runes for the duration. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.
For the duration, whenever a creature marked by this spell takes fire damage from any source, it takes an additional {@damage 1d8} fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d12|2-9|1d12} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Mental Projection

time.condition: which you take when you receive a telepathic message or vision

m.text: a small crystal, piece of glass or lens worth at least 1gp

entries: You project a thought, memory, or mental message into a visual and/or auditory presentation through the material component. You can choose how much of the message or memory to play, but you cannot alter it.

For example, a message received via the {@spell Sending} spell can be converted into an auditory projection, allowing multiple creatures to hear the message. Similarly, while the spell is active, any visions or divinations you receive are projected in a 15-foot radius from you.
You can end the spell at any time (no action required). Being {@condition incapacitated} does not end the spell.

spell.name: Converse

m.text: a mirror, window or other reflective or transparent surface worth at least 1cp

entries: You attempt to establish two-way visual and auditory communication with a creature you are familiar with. The material component links to an ethereal copy of the surface that appears before the target. The original surface and the copy are linked, showing what passes before the other.

If you target a creature on a different plane of existence, there is a 5 percent chance that the spell fails to connect. The target must accept the communication for the link to be established. You or any contacted creature can end the communication at any time (no action required). The spell ends if all creatures end their link.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target two additional creatures for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Abyssal Strike
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon glistens with bubbles and steam, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} cold damage. The target is also surrounded by tumultuous water until the spell ends.

While surrounded by the water, the target's space is difficult terrain, and it cannot speak. At the start of each of its turns, the target can make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, the spell ends for that target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial extra damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d6|1-9|1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Tidal Blast
entries: You conjure high-pressured water at a point on the ground within range, which swells into a powerful wave that travels in a 60-foot-long, 10-foot-wide line in a direction of your choice. Each creature in the line must make a Strength saving throw.

On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage, is pushed 30 feet in the direction of the wave, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage, is pushed only 10 feet, and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the bludgeoning damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d6|4-9|2d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Quicken Fall

time.condition: which you take when a creature within 300 feet of you falls

entries: Choose one falling creature you can see in range. The creature's rate of descent triples each round until the spell ends.

If the creature lands before the spell ends, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, the creature takes the normal amount of falling damage. On a failure, it takes three times the normal falling damage (roll three times the usual number of dice).
Regardless of the save's result, the creature can then make a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (its choice) against your spell save DC to land on its feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target two additional creatures for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Konstantin's Shattering Shards
entries: You create eight razor-sharp shards of true ice and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several.

Make a ranged spell attack for each shard. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} piercing damage and {@damage 2d4} cold damage. The shard then splinters, creating a 15-foot cone of icy fragments originating from the target's space and facing directly away from you. Each creature in that cone must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d4} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you create two additional shards for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Cacophony of Carnage

m.text: a soul coin, which is consumed

entries: You toss a soul coin into the air which bursts into a cacophony of laughter. Choose up to three creatures you can see within range. For the duration, each target is emboldened by bloodlust and gains a {@damage 1d4} bonus to the damage of its weapon attacks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Embolden Pride
entries: You toss a soul coin into the air, causing one creature of your choice within range to feel its pride swell. For the duration, the target gains 10 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns. When the spell ends, the target loses any temporary hit points gained from this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the temporary hit points gained each turn increases by 5 for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Fear Bolt

m.text: a soul coin, which is consumed

entries: You throw a soul coin that transforms into a black bolt of power. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 1d12} psychic damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, for every 1 foot the creature moves toward you, it must expend 2 feet of movement. This effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d12|1-9|1d12} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Vurrel's Wave of Radiance
entries: You raise a sword and call down a burst of radiance. Each creature of your choice in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 8d6} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
After the damage is dealt, choose one creature that took damage from the spell and one ally you can see. That ally regains hit points equal to half the radiant damage the chosen creature took.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the radiant damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d6|5-9|1d6} for each slot level above 5th. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can choose one additional ally to regain hit points for every two slot levels above 5th.

spell.name: Vurrel's Golden Ward
entries: You raise your hand, creating a golden ward of protection around up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range. Each target gains 40 temporary hit points and a +2 bonus to AC. The spell ends for a creature when it loses all temporary hit points granted by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 10 for each slot level above 4th. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the AC bonus increases by 1 for every two slot levels above 4th.

spell.name: Vurrel's Dawn of Battle
entries: You call down a blessing from the sky, creating a 30-foot-radius, 60-foot-high cylinder of divine light centered on a point you can see within range. For the duration, each creature of your choice that enters the cylinder for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there can choose one of the following blessings. The benefit lasts as long as the creature remains in the cylinder.

items.name: Sword.
items.entry: Your weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d8} radiant damage.

items.name: Shield.
items.entry: You gain a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws.

items.name: Armor.
items.entry: All abjuration spells you cast are treated as if they were cast with a spell slot two levels higher. If the spell is 6th level or lower, you can instead choose to target two additional creatures with it.

entries: When the spell ends, you must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 9th-level spell slot, a creature can choose two blessings instead of one.

spell.name: Vurrel's Bright Strike
entries: You enchant one weapon you can see within range with divine energy. The next time a creature hits a target with an attack using that weapon before the spell ends, the attack deals an additional {@damage 2d6} radiant damage, and the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by 15 feet until the end of your next turn. The spell then ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional weapon and the range increases by 15 feet for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Vurrel's Aura of Light
entries: You create a divine aura in a 10-foot radius around you. Until the end of your next turn, whenever a creature of your choice in the aura (including you) makes a weapon attack, it deals an additional {@damage 1d4} radiant damage.

spell.name: Vurrel's Shield of Morael

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within range is hit by an attack

components.m: a shield with a holy symbol of Morael engraved on it

entries: You conjure a divine shield to protect an ally. The triggering creature gains a +5 bonus to its AC against the triggering attack. This bonus then applies against all other attacks made by the same attacker until the start of that attacker's next turn.
Additionally, until the spell ends, when the protected ally takes damage, you can use your reaction to reduce your own hit points by 5 to reduce the damage the ally takes by 5.

spell.name: Vurrel's Mighty Crusade
entries: You empower up to two creatures of your choice within range. Until the end of your next turn, each target has advantage on all attack rolls. On its next turn, a target can also move an additional 20 feet and can make one additional weapon attack if it takes the Attack action. That additional attack deals an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage on a hit.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for every two slot levels above 5th.

spell.name: Vurrel's Steed of Empyreus

components.m: a sword with a holy symbol of Empyreus engraved on it

entries: You throw a sword to the sky, where it transforms into a divine steed. You summon a {@creature Pegasus} that appears beneath you, except it has the following changes:

items: It is Huge.
It is immune to all damage and conditions.
It cannot take any actions other than Dash and Disengage.

entries: While you are riding the steed, you and up to seven other creatures of your choice within 60 feet of you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain half cover.
Once per turn, when you deal damage with a spell or an attack, you can deal additional radiant damage equal to 5 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

spell.name: Summon Puppet

m.text: a wooden doll rigged with golden strings worth at least 300 gp

entries: You call forth a wooden doll under your command. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range and uses the {@creature Puppet|CLDR} stat block. The puppet's size is one size category larger than you.
When you cast the spell, choose one of the following models for the puppet: Boisterous, Gallant, or Evasive. The puppet's appearance and traits are determined by the chosen model.

The puppet is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, it shares your initiative count and acts on your turn. It takes the Dodge action unless you use your action to command it to take any other action. You can use the action from casting this spell to issue your first command.
The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

spell.name: Looky Loo
entries: You touch one willing creature. For the duration, your senses merge with the target's. As an action, you can start or stop perceiving through the target's senses. While perceiving through the target, you are {@condition blind} and {@condition deafened} with regard to your own surroundings, and you can communicate telepathically with the target.
The spell's effects are suppressed while you and the target are on different planes of existence. You can end the spell early as an action.

spell.name: Glimpse
entries: You grant a creature you can see a brief glimpse into its immediate future. Choose one creature within range. The next attack roll made against the target before the spell ends has disadvantage. For each attack roll that has disadvantage because of this spell, the target gains advantage on the next attack roll it makes against the creature that attacked it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the number of attacks that can be affected increases by one for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shadow Sanctuary

m.text: a shard of obsidian or jet worth at least 10gp

entries: You create a 30-foot-radius sphere of shadows centered on a point within range. Whenever a hostile creature starts its turn within the radius, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 4d8} piercing damage and its speed is halved until the start of its next turn. If a creature fails this saving throw for two consecutive turns, it is {@condition restrained} by the shadows until the start of its next turn.
Whenever an allied creature starts its turn within the radius, its speed is increased by 15 feet and it ignores difficult terrain until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the piercing damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d8|4-9|1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Hurtling Snowball
entries: You conjure and hurl a well-packed snowball at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d4} cold damage and {@damage 2d4} bludgeoning damage. If the target is concentrating on a spell, it has disadvantage on the Constitution saving throw it makes to maintain its concentration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, both the cold and the bludgeoning damage increase by {@damage 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Intaglio Automaton

m.text: a collection of paper and a jewel-encrusted quill worth at least 100 gp

entries: You conjure an automaton to scribe for you. It appears in an unoccupied space you can see within range. The automaton is a Medium construct with an AC of 10, a walking speed of 30 feet, and hit points equal to 10  the spell's level. It has all the senses you had when the spell was cast and can understand and write all languages you knew at that time.
The automaton cannot take actions, but you can verbally command it (no action required) to perform one of the following tasks:

items.name: Transcribe.
items.entry: The automaton perfectly transcribes all spoken words and sounds it can hear. You can command it to exclude certain sounds or only transcribe specific creatures.

items.name: Replicate.
items.entry: The automaton perfectly copies all written words it can see. You can command it to only copy specific text. If used to copy a spell into a spellbook, you must still pay all associated time and gold costs.

items.name: Editorialize.
items.entry: The automaton transcribes or copies text with specific stipulations, such as embellishing certain actions or translating text into another language it knows.

entries: The automaton disappears if its hit points are reduced to 0, if you dismiss it as an action, or if you cast this spell again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, the duration increases to 8 hours. When you cast it using a 6th or 7th-level slot, the duration is 24 hours. When you cast it using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the spell lasts until it is dispelled.

spell.name: Alluring Eminence
entries: You wreathe yourself in charming magic. Whenever a creature starts its turn able to see you, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. It has advantage on the save if you or your companions are fighting it.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see you until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at you in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

On a failed save, the creature is {@condition charmed} by you for the duration. The charm ends if you or your companions do anything harmful to the creature. A charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.

spell.name: Animus Blast
entries: You unleash a blast of frigid death at a point you can see within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 50d6} cold damage, or half as much on a successful save.
Any creature killed by this damage is instantly animated as a {@creature Skeleton}. These skeletons are permanently under your command and follow your verbal orders to the best of their ability.

spell.name: Animus Blizzard
entries: A blizzard of soul-chilling energy erupts from a point you can see within range, filling a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 40d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Up to five creatures killed by this damage are instantly animated as {@creature Wight|wights}. These wights are permanently under your command and follow your verbal orders to the best of their ability.

spell.name: Arcane Guillotine
entries: You target one {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained}, or {@condition incapacitated} creature within range, evoking a blade of pure force to execute it. Make a melee spell attack against the target. This attack scores a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 30d6} slashing damage and {@damage 30d6} force damage. If the attack roll is a natural 20, you can choose to sever one of the target's limbs. If you choose a limb the creature cannot survive without (such as its head), the target instead takes an additional 50 slashing damage. If this damage kills the target, the limb is severed regardless.

spell.name: Arctic Impalement
entries: You cause jagged, pointed spires of ice to erupt from areas of ground you choose within range. The spires can be up to 60 feet high. Each creature in an area when it erupts must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 10d10} piercing damage and {@damage 10d10} cold damage and is impaled by the spires. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not impaled.

An impaled creature has its speed reduced to 0 and can't be moved. It can take only one action on its turn, and it can't regain hit points. The creature, or another creature within 5 feet of it, can use its action to make a Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC, freeing the impaled creature on a success.

If a creature is forcibly moved 15 feet or more into an area of spires, the one who forced the movement can make an attack roll using their relevant ability score. On a hit, the target is impaled as if it had failed its saving throw against the spell.

The area covered by spires is difficult terrain. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes {@damage 2d10} piercing damage and {@damage 2d10} cold damage for every 5 feet it travels. A creature can move at one-quarter its normal speed to avoid taking this damage.
When the spell ends, the spires sink back into the ground, freeing any impaled creatures.

spell.name: Demise Unseen
entries: You attempt to slay a single creature you can see within range that has 100 hit points or fewer. The target must make a Constitution saving throw.

On a successful save, the target drops dead. On a failed save, the target dies, but you instantly animate its body so that it appears unharmed. The body is now a {@creature ghoul} under your permanent control. To an outside observer, the target appears to be alive; a creature can use its action to make an Intelligence (Investigation) or Wisdom (Insight) check against your spell save DC to discern the truth.

spell.name: Epic Mage Armor
entries: An invisible but tangible field of force surrounds you. For the duration, your base Armor Class becomes 18 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell is not considered to be armor.

spell.name: Fortune Field

components.m: A coin marked with weal and woe

entries: You release an aura of twisted fortune in a 30-foot radius around you. For the duration, whenever an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw is made by a creature within the aura, or targets a creature within the aura, you can use your reaction to roll {@dice 2d4} and either add or subtract the result from the d20 roll.

Additionally, you can choose any number of creatures within the aura. Attack rolls against the chosen creatures can't be made with advantage. You can also choose any number of other creatures within the aura. Their attack rolls, checks, and saving throws can't be made with disadvantage.

spell.name: Godrays
entries: You cause up to ten golden beams of light to pierce down from the heavens. Each beam is a 10-foot-radius, 1,000-foot-high cylinder centered on a point you can see within range. For the duration, bright light fills each cylinder, with dim light for 60 feet around it. The light is sunlight.

When a creature enters a cylinder for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it is engulfed in solar flames and must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 20d10} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
A shapechanger makes its saving throw with disadvantage. If it fails, it also instantly reverts to its original form and can't assume a different form until it leaves the spell's light.
At the start of each of your turns, you can move any number of the beams up to 60 feet in any direction (no action required).
A creature can only be affected by one beam at a time. This spell cannot be cast underground.

spell.name: Greater Demiplane

time.condition: (requiring 8 hours of work per day for 7 days)

m.text: 10,000 gp worth of rare crystal dust, which the spell consumes

entries: While on a non-material plane, you touch a point and begin to coalesce the plane's raw energy into your own personal demiplane. Over the 7 days of casting, you create a demiplane in the form of a cube with 1-mile-long sides, adjacent to the plane you are on. You determine the demiplane's environment, including its atmosphere, temperature, and the general shape of its terrain. The spell cannot create life (including vegetation) or pre-existing structures.

While within your demiplane, spells you cast that can be made permanent over a year (such as {@spell Mighty Fortress} or {@spell Temple of the Gods}) become permanent after only one month of continuous casting.
If you attempt to cast this spell to create a second demiplane, the first one is destroyed, and its contents are scattered across the plane it was originally bound to.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell at 11th level, you can increase the material component cost by an additional 10,000 gp to expand the demiplane to a 5-mile-radius sphere. If you cast it at 12th level and increase the cost by another 10,000 gp, the radius expands to 10 miles. Any existing structures remain at the center of the expanded plane.

spell.name: Greater Ruin
entries: A beam of pure destructive force streaks toward a target you can see within range. The target can be a creature or a cube of nonliving matter up to 30 feet on a side. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 70d6} force damage, or half as much on a successful one. An object automatically fails this saving throw.
A creature, construct, or object reduced to 0 hit points by this spell is utterly destroyed, leaving behind only a trace of fine dust.

spell.name: Greater Undead Enthrallment

m.text: a clay pot filled with brackish water, another clay pot filled with grave dirt, and a black onyx stone worth at least 500 gp for each corpse used

entries: This spell can only be cast at night. You choose one or more corpses within range, which your spell imbues with a foul mimicry of life, raising it as an undead creature of CR 10 or lower (the GM has the creature's game statistics). The number of corpses required is determined by the GM based on the size of the creature being animated.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if it is within 60 feet of you. You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move on its next turn, or you can issue a general command. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself. It continues to follow a command until the task is complete.

The creature is under your control for 24 hours. To maintain control for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over one creature you have animated, rather than animating a new one. A creature you have maintained this way for 30 consecutive days becomes permanently under your control. You can control a maximum of six creatures with this spell at one time.

spell.name: Hellball
entries: You hurl a massive ball of volatile energy to a point you can see, which explodes in a 40-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 15d6} acid damage, {@damage 15d6} fire damage, {@damage 15d6} lightning damage, and {@damage 15d6} thunder damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.
Objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried also take this damage.

spell.name: Kinetic Control
entries: For the duration, you can absorb the energy from physical attacks. You take no damage from slashing, bludgeoning, and piercing damage from attacks made against you. Instead, the damage is stored within you.

You can store up to a maximum of 200 points of damage. If the stored damage is not discharged before reaching this limit, the spell automatically discharges, dealing all 200 points of damage to you, unless you use your reaction to make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, that creature takes 200 force damage. If you miss or there is no target, you take the damage.

At any time during the spell's duration, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature or object you can touch. On a hit, you can expend some or all of your stored damage, dealing that much force damage to the target. When the spell expires, any remaining stored damage is discharged into you.

spell.name: Momento Mori
entries: You will one creature you can see within range with 150 hit points or fewer to die. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. If the save fails, the target dies instantly. If the save is successful, the target instead takes {@damage 20d6 + 30} necrotic damage.

spell.name: Mountainbreaker
entries: You focus titanic sonic energy into your hand and strike a creature or object you can touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes {@damage 40d6} thunder damage and must make a Strength saving throw or be flung {@dice 20d6 * 5} feet directly away from you.

Each creature and object in a 90-foot cone originating from the initial target must also make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 10d6} thunder damage and is flung 30 feet away from you. On a successful save, it takes half damage and is not flung.

A creature flung by this spell that collides with a surface or an object larger than itself takes {@damage 10d6} bludgeoning damage and falls {@condition prone}. If it collides with an object smaller than itself, it crashes through it and continues its movement.
Objects take five times the normal damage from this spell's effects.

spell.name: Raigeki
entries: You evoke a bolt of pure lightning to strike a point you can see within range. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 50d6} lightning damage, is {@condition stunned}, and can't take reactions for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.
All creatures other than you within 100 feet of the bolt's impact must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition deafened} until the end of their next turn.

A stunned creature repeats its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, taking {@damage 10d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or ending the stunned condition on a successful one. A creature can remain stunned by this effect for up to one minute.
This spell cannot be cast underground.

spell.name: Ravenous Bileflood

components.m: The fangs of a great and venomous beast

entries: A wall of putrid bile and corrosive sludge springs into existence at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 100 feet long, 30 feet high, and 50 feet thick.

When the wall appears, each Huge or smaller creature within its area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is caught within the wall. A creature that starts its turn in the wall takes {@damage 10d6} necrotic, {@damage 10d6} poison, and {@damage 10d6} acid damage.

At the start of each of your turns, you can move the wall up to 60 feet in a direction of your choice, carrying any creatures caught within it. Any creature whose space the wall enters must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be caught by the wall. Instead of moving the wall, you can reshape it into a 50-foot-radius, 20-foot-high vortex. A creature that fails its save to escape the vortex is pulled 20 feet closer to its center.

A creature caught in the wall can use its action to make a Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC. On a success, it moves up to half its speed and can leave the wall if it has enough movement. On a failure, it can't move.
The wall consumes organic material and picks non-corrosive objects clean.

spell.name: Nailed To The Sky
entries: You target one creature or object weighing up to 1,000 lbs. that you can see within range. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it is instantly teleported to the upper limit of the planet's atmosphere, entering a stable orbit.

Unless the target can fly by magical means, it is stranded. Even with magical flight, returning to the surface can take hours. While in orbit, a creature is subject to the vacuum of space, taking {@damage 2d6} cold damage, {@damage 2d6} fire damage (from solar radiation), and {@damage 1d4} other damage per round, and immediately begins to {@condition suffocate}.

spell.name: Soul Scry
entries: You attempt to tap into the consciousness of a creature you are familiar with. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell fails, and the target is unaware of the intrusion. On a failed save, you experience everything the target does with all five senses for the duration. You cannot control the target's actions. During this time, your own body remains in a trance-like state. If the target is knocked unconscious or killed, the spell ends immediately.

spell.name: Spell Weave
entries: Your arcane mastery allows you to weave together two spells. Choose two different spells of 9th level or lower that you are able to cast, each with a casting time of 1 action or 1 bonus action. You cast both spells simultaneously as part of the action used to cast this spell.

If both weaved spells have a duration longer than 1 round, the combined spell's duration is equal to that of the spell with the shorter duration. If either weaved spell requires concentration, you concentrate on them as a single spell. The combined spell is considered to be a spell of a level equal to the sum of the two weaved spells' levels.

spell.name: Time Duplicate
entries: You snatch a duplicate of yourself from 1 round in the future, which appears in an unoccupied space adjacent to you. This casting does not prevent you from casting another leveled spell on your turn.

Your future self acts on your turn, is free to act normally, and has all the resources (hit points, spell slots, etc.) you had at the moment you finished casting this spell. It has no special knowledge of what will occur during the current round.
The following round-by-round effects apply:

items.name: Round 1 (Casting Round).
items.entry: You and your duplicate both act normally. You have already used your bonus action for the turn.

items.name: Round 2.
items.entry: You are absent from this round, having been pulled back to Round 1. No version of you is present to act.

items.name: Round 3.
items.entry: You rejoin the time stream. You appear in the same location and condition that your duplicate was in at the end of Round 1. Any resources expended by the duplicate in Round 1 are now expended by you.

entries: Tampering with the time stream is a tricky business; you cannot summon more than one duplicate or a duplicate from further than 1 round in the future.

spell.name: Vengeful Gaze Of God
entries: You target one creature or a cube of nonliving matter up to 30 feet on a side that you can see. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 60d6} radiant damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.
A creature or object reduced to 0 hit points by this spell is utterly destroyed, leaving behind only a trace of fine dust.

spell.name: Yggdrasil's Sap

components.m: bark from a tree on the upper planes

entries: You touch a container and fill it with up to 5 cups of magical sap. As an action, a creature can drink one cup.

Drinking one cup provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for 7 days. The creature is also cured of any diseases, all levels of {@condition exhaustion}, and the {@condition poisoned} condition.
The creature can also choose one of the following additional benefits:

items: End all effects that are {@condition charmed} or {@condition petrified|petrifying} it.
Remove all curses affecting it, including its attunement to any cursed magic items.
Remove any reductions to all of its ability scores.
Remove any effect reducing its hit point maximum.

entries: Any undrunk sap loses its magical properties after 7 days.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 11th level or higher, you produce an additional 3 cups of sap.

spell.name: Weave Mythal

time.condition: (this time is divided by the number of epic-level spellcasters participating in the casting)

m.text: 50,000 gp worth of diamond dust

entries: You create a permanent, spherical ward of potent magic. The base radius of the sphere is 300 feet, which you can increase by 300 feet for each of your spellcaster levels above 30. You can choose to make the sphere smaller than this maximum.
The mythal is impenetrable to all living creatures, undead, constructs, and similar beings unless they know the specific activation key (a word, phrase, or action) you set when you cast the spell.

While active, the mythal suppresses all environmental planar effects within its boundary, such as those from a psychic storm, the Negative or Positive Energy planes, or the extreme temperatures of an elemental plane. Any attempt to cross the boundary or create a magical gate to a point within it without using the activation key fails, and the creature attempting to do so is subjected to the mythal's bound effects.

You can bind a number of unique spells or magical effects to the mythal. You can bind one spell of 6th level or lower with an instantaneous duration for every five levels you have in a full caster class (rounded down). For example, you could bind {@spell Lightning Bolt} to strike any creature that tries to enter without the key. The spell's effects can be modified; for instance, the bound lightning bolt could target a number of creatures equal to your level when you created the mythal.
If a Mythallar is present within the mythal, the Mythallar's area of effect is increased to match the size of the mythal.
The mythal cannot be dispelled by {@spell Dispel Magic}.

spell.name: Amnestic Demand

duration.special: Instantaneous, or concentration up to 1 minute

entries: You command the memory of the last hour to leave all sentient creatures of your choice within 120 feet of you. Each target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or lose all memory of the last hour and become dazed until the beginning of its next turn (while dazed, a creature can't take actions or reactions).

Alternatively, you can target a single creature. If it fails its saving throw, you can choose to enter a state of pure focus for up to 1 minute, delving into its memories. While in this state, both you and the target are {@condition incapacitated}. This effect ends for both of you if either is harmed or if the target succeeds on its saving throw, which it can repeat at the end of each of its turns. The scope of your memory alteration depends on how long you maintain this focused state:

entries.caption: Memory Alteration
rows: Alter minor details, such as a single word in a sentence or hair color.
Alter behavior, appearance, and names of remembered creatures, or perceptions of environments.
One of the last two months
Alter or fabricate entire events, including all participants and locations.
Three months of the last five years
Erase memories or edit/fabricate the target's remembered thoughts during events.
Absolute control over the memories within the viewed period.

entries: A creature whose core memories are severely altered or erased may develop mental illnesses or descend into madness. Only a {@spell wish}, a {@spell greater restoration} or {@spell remove curse} cast with a 10th-level spell slot, or divine intervention can restore memory lost to this spell.

spell.name: Domain Expansion
entries: You expand a manifestation of your ideal domain, creating a barrier that extends from you up to 120 feet, enclosing creatures of your choice. This barrier lasts for the duration or until you end it (no action required).
While you are within the barrier, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a +5 bonus to your AC, saving throws, spell save DC, and all attack and damage rolls.
You are always considered to be within 5 feet of any target inside the domain for the purpose of your attacks and spells (this does not confer disadvantage on ranged attacks).
You gain access to three Lair Actions, which you design with the DM's approval when you first learn this spell. The verbal component for this spell is the name you give your domain.

entries: The barrier has an AC equal to your spell save DC and 1,000 hit points. If destroyed, a permanent opening is created. A creature can also make a Charisma saving throw to teleport into or out of the barrier; on a failure, the attempt is wasted.
When the spell ends, you gain two levels of {@condition exhaustion} and cannot cast spells of 6th level or higher for a number of rounds equal to the number of rounds the domain was active.

entries.name: Countering the Domain
entries: If another caster casts this spell within an existing domain, the casters make a contested spellcasting ability check. The loser's domain collapses, and they immediately suffer the spell's end penalties. If the new spell is of a higher level, it automatically wins. If the check is a tie, the domains merge into a hybrid state where both casters gain the benefits of their domains, but lose the 'always within 5 feet' effect.
This spell cannot be dispelled by {@spell Dispel Magic}.

spell.name: Dire Winter
entries: You emanate bitter cold from a point you can see, creating a blizzard in a 10-mile radius for the duration. A creature not behind total cover from the storm takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage at the start of each of its turns. Additionally, for every hour a creature spends in the storm, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.
Creatures resistant to cold damage do not take the damage but must still make the saving throw against exhaustion. Creatures immune to cold ignore all effects of the spell.
A {@spell control weather} spell cast using a 9th-level spell slot can suppress the effects of this spell within its 5-mile radius for its duration. This spell cannot otherwise be dispelled.

spell.name: Dragonwhirl

components.m: a drop of red dragon blood

entries: A howling vortex of flame descends to a point on the ground you specify. The whirlwind is a 20-foot-radius, 300-foot-high cylinder. At the start of each of your turns, you can move the whirlwind up to 120 feet along the ground. The whirlwind sucks up unsecured Huge or smaller objects and reduces flammable objects to ash.

When a creature first enters the whirlwind on a turn or the whirlwind enters its space, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 10d6} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 25d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A Huge or smaller creature that fails the save must also succeed on a Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} in the whirlwind.

A creature that starts its turn restrained by the whirlwind is pulled 5 feet higher and takes {@damage 25d6} fire damage. A restrained creature moves with the whirlwind and falls when the spell ends. It can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check against your spell save DC. On a success, it is no longer restrained and is hurled {@dice 10d6 * 10} feet away in a random direction.
This spell cannot be cast underground.

spell.name: Future Sight

m.text: a clock that spins backwards with a diamond dial worth 1,000 gp

duration.special: Instantaneous, or concentration up to 1 hour

entries: You peer into the future. You can choose to cast this spell instantaneously for a brief glimpse, or concentrate to see further. While concentrating, you are unaware of your present surroundings. The quality of your vision depends on the time spent focusing:
You view a possible future; acting on this knowledge may change the outcome. The DM has final say on the information gleaned.

spell.name: Gatecrash

m.text: a black pearl worth 5,000 gp

entries: You pull a random plane to violently converge with your own in a 120-foot radius centered on you. Roll a d8 to determine the plane and its effects. When the spell is cast, creatures other than you in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 20d8} damage of the plane's type on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can reroll the d8, changing the planar effect. When you do, creatures in the area must repeat the saving throw, taking {@damage 10d8} damage of the new plane's type on a failed save, or half on a success.

entries.caption: Gatecrash Planes
rows: Deals piercing damage. A creature starting its turn in the area must make a Dexterity save or take {@damage 15d8} piercing damage and be {@condition restrained} until the start of its next turn.
Deals force damage. A creature starting its turn in the area must make a Wisdom save or take {@damage 15d8} force damage and be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.
Deals psychic damage. A creature starting its turn in the area must roll a d6. On a 4 or lower, it loses its movement for the turn and takes {@damage 14d8} psychic damage.

Deals cold damage. A creature starting its turn in the area must make a Strength save or take {@damage 18d8} cold damage, be knocked {@condition prone}, and be pulled 60 feet toward the center. On a success, it is pulled 30 feet and suffers no other effects. Moving away from the center costs 10 feet of movement per 1 foot traveled.

Deals bludgeoning damage. A creature starting its turn in the area must make a Strength save or be pulled into the ground, becoming {@condition paralyzed}, having its speed reduced to 0, beginning to {@condition suffocate}, and taking {@damage 18d8} bludgeoning damage. A creature can repeat the save at the end of its turns.

Deals lightning damage. A creature starting its turn in the area must make a Constitution save or take {@damage 22d8} lightning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. Verbal spell components fail, all are {@condition deafened}, and ground-based movement is 0. Creatures are moved 60 feet around the center.
Deals fire damage. A creature starting its turn in the area takes {@damage 28d8} fire damage and must make a Constitution save or be {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.

Deals necrotic damage. A creature starting its turn in the area takes {@damage 35d8} necrotic damage and must make a Constitution save or automatically fail one death saving throw. A creature that fails three death saves this way has its body consumed.

spell.name: Mavin's Worldweave

components.m: one of each of the Rings of Elemental Command

entries: You permanently alter the weather patterns within a vast area, with a radius of 5 miles for each of your spellcaster levels. You can change the climate of the area by one grade (e.g., from temperate to subarctic), as determined by the DM. Multiple castings of this spell can be layered to change the climate by more than one step.

spell.name: Necromorphosis
entries: You begin the complex process of transforming a corpse into a bespoke undead servant. To complete the ritual, you must succeed on a cumulative spellcasting ability check, rolling once each time you cast this spell on the same corpse. The total DC is equal to 30  the creature's original CR (halved for Necromancy Wizards, Death Clerics, Undead Warlocks, and Requiems Bards).

Upon completion, the corpse rises as an undead under your permanent control. It retains its abilities, memories, and most statistics from life, but its alignment becomes lawful evil. You choose one of the following forms, which alters its statistics:

items: Skeletal: +2 Str, +2 Dex, -2 Int, -2 Cha; vulnerability to bludgeoning; proficiency with 5 martial weapons and light/medium armor and shields.
Zombified: +1 Str, +2 Con, -6 Int, -4 Wis, -4 Cha; -10 ft. speed; Undead Fortitude.
Spectral: -4 Str, -4 Con, +2 Cha; flying (hover) speed; Incorporeal Movement; Ethereal Sight; Sunlight Hypersensitivity.
Unmodified: No changes.

entries: You can control up to four creatures of CR 15 or higher created with this spell.

spell.name: Perfect Warrior
entries: You draw the legendary weapon used in the casting and embody the perfect warrior. For the duration, you cannot cast spells but gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with all weapons, armor, and shields.
You can don or doff a set of armor as an action.
You automatically attune to the weapon used in the casting, bypassing its requirements. This attunement lasts until the spell ends.
You have advantage on all attack rolls.
When you hit with an attack, it deals an extra 4 dice of the attack's base damage type.
You can make a number of attacks on your turn equal to your level divided by 10 (rounded up).
You gain temporary hit points equal to 10  your spellcaster level.

entries: When the spell ends, you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your own spell save DC or suffer two levels of {@condition exhaustion}.

spell.name: Premonition
entries: You touch a willing creature, granting it prescient insight. For the duration, the target gains the following benefits:

items: It cannot be surprised.
It can treat any d20 roll of 14 or lower for initiative as a 15.
It has advantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.
It can treat any d20 roll of 9 or lower on an ability check as a 10.
It has resistance to all damage.
Attack rolls against it have disadvantage.

spell.name: Tectonic Vice
entries: You target a 100-foot-long, 60-foot-wide strip of earth, which folds upward along its center. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 70d10} bludgeoning damage, is {@condition restrained}, and begins to {@condition suffocate} as it is entombed in earth. A creature that succeeds on its save can use its reaction to move to the nearest unoccupied space outside the area. A creature that can't move or take reactions automatically fails the save.

Objects in the area take double damage and automatically fail the save. The folded earth forms a 30-foot-high mound of difficult terrain. A creature trapped within can use its action to make a Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC to free itself.
This spell cannot be cast in a place without ground.

spell.name: Aspect of Nature

components.m: the heart of an Elder Elemental

entries: You draw elemental energies into yourself and become an avatar of nature, choosing one of four elements: Air, Earth, Fire, or Water. Your size becomes Huge, your equipment grows with you, and your appearance changes to reflect your chosen element. For the duration, you gain all the benefits of your chosen aspect.

items: You gain a flying speed of 90 feet (hover).
You gain immunity to lightning and thunder damage.
If you are subjected to lightning damage, you take no damage and instead regain a number of hit points equal to half the lightning damage dealt.
You are immune to the {@condition exhausted}, {@condition grappled}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition prone}, and {@condition restrained} conditions.
You can cast spells with a casting time of 1 action that deal lightning or thunder damage as a bonus action. When you do so, the spell is cast as if using a spell slot one level higher.
You have advantage on initiative rolls and on saving throws against effects that would inflict the {@condition incapacitated} condition.
If you fail a saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead. You can use this feature 3 times.

entries.name: Storm Aura
entries: As a bonus action, you can create a storm of swirling wind and debris in a 30-foot radius around you. A creature of your choice that starts its turn in the aura must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning and {@damage 2d10} piercing damage on a failed save. While the aura is active, you and creatures of your choice have half cover from creatures attacking from within the aura, and three-quarters cover from creatures attacking from outside the aura.

items: You gain a burrow speed of 90 feet and tremorsense out to 120 feet.
You gain resistance to fire, cold, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
You are immune to the {@condition exhausted}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, and {@condition poisoned} conditions.

You can cast spells with a casting time of 1 action that are thematically tied to earth (such as those that influence earth or plants, at the DM's discretion) as a bonus action. When you do so, the spell is cast as if using a spell slot one level higher.
If you fail a saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead. You can use this feature 3 times.
Your attacks deal an additional {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage.
You deal double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Earth Slam
entries: You gain an additional reaction per round that can only be used for this feature. If a creature misses you with a melee attack while within your reach, you can use this special reaction to make a melee attack against it.

items: Your movement speed increases by 40 feet.
You gain immunity to fire damage and resistance to radiant, cold, and poison damage.
If you are subjected to fire damage, you take no damage and instead regain a number of hit points equal to half the fire damage dealt.
You are immune to the {@condition exhausted}, {@condition grappled}, and {@condition restrained} conditions.
You can cast spells with a casting time of 1 action that deal fire damage as a bonus action. When you do so, the spell is cast as if using a spell slot one level higher.
If you fail a saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead. You can use this feature 3 times.
Your attacks deal an additional {@damage 2d6} fire damage.

entries.name: Fire Form
entries: You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches you or hits you with a melee attack while within 10 feet of you takes {@damage 4d10} fire damage. You can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time you enter a hostile creature's space on a turn, that creature takes {@damage 4d10} fire damage and catches fire. Until a creature takes an action to douse the flames, the target takes {@damage 2d10} fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

items: You gain a swim speed of 90 feet.
You gain immunity to cold, acid, and poison damage.
If you are subjected to cold damage, you take no damage and instead regain a number of hit points equal to half the cold damage dealt.
You are immune to the {@condition exhausted}, {@condition grappled}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}, {@condition prone}, and {@condition restrained} conditions.
You can cast spells with a casting time of 1 action that deal cold damage as a bonus action. When you do so, the spell is cast as if using a spell slot one level higher.
If you fail a saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead. You can use this feature 3 times.
Your attacks deal an additional {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage.
Whenever you restore hit points to a creature or grant it temporary hit points, you can increase the amount by {@dice 2d6}.

entries.name: Water Form
entries: You can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. You can also move through a space as narrow as 6 inches wide without squeezing.

spell.name: Mass Resurrection

m.text: diamonds worth a total of 1,000,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You restore to life all creatures of your choice within range that have died within the last 7 days. A creature's soul must be willing to return to life for the spell to affect it.
The spell restores any missing body parts and cures all normal diseases, but it does not remove magical diseases or curses. The creature returns to life with 1 hit point.

This spell cannot return to life a creature that has died of old age. All creatures restored to life by this spell have disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until they finish a long rest.

spell.name: Mass Shapechange

m.text: jade circlets worth 1,500 gp each, which must be worn by each creature affected by the spell

entries: You and up to ten willing creatures of your choice within range that are wearing the required jade circlets gain the benefits of the {@spell Shapechange} spell for the duration. Each affected creature can choose its own form and acts independently.

Each creature affected by this spell concentrates on it individually. If you lose your concentration for any reason, all other creatures affected by the spell must make their own concentration checks with disadvantage to maintain their form.

spell.name: Origin of Species
entries: This spell allows you to design and create a new species of creature. The creature must have a Challenge Rating of 5 or lower, and its statistics must be approved by the DM.

Upon completion of the casting, the spell creates a breeding pair (or equivalent) of the new species, along with a secluded demiplane with sufficient resources to sustain them for 120 days. The creatures are fully grown and imbued with knowledge you grant them, such as mannerisms and cultural identity.

For the first month, the creatures multiply rapidly, establishing a base population of 1,000. Afterward, their birth rate returns to normal. These creatures are independent and not under your control.

spell.name: Panacea of Creation

m.text: an icon of celestial power worth 500,000 gp, which must have been charged in the Positive Energy Plane for 1 year

entries: You touch one willing creature, spreading true purification throughout its being. The target is cured of all curses, diseases, conditions, and any other negative effects. It gains the benefits of a long rest, its ability scores are restored to their normal maximums, and its lifespan is increased by 100 years. A creature cannot regain a 12th-level spell slot from this spell's long rest effect.

Alternatively, you can touch a piece of a dead creature's body. The spell restores the creature to life, forming a new body for it at its physical peak in an unoccupied space within 5 feet. This can even revive a creature that died of old age. The revived creature gains all the other benefits of this spell.
Once a creature receives the benefits of this spell, it must roll a d100. On a roll of 33 or lower, it can never benefit from this spell again.

spell.name: Traverse Time

components.m: a bone from a deity who represents time

entries: You target a point in time within the past hour and instantly travel to it, appearing in the same location you were at that moment. The timeline resets to that point; all actions and events that occurred between then and the moment you cast this spell are undone.

All memory of the erased time is removed from every creature except for you. Any other creature that knows this spell is aware that it was cast and can use its reaction to make a DC 35 spellcasting ability check (with proficiency). On a success, it also remembers the erased period of time.

spell.name: Weave Confluence

components.m: a purified shard of pure mana

entries: You create a mana confluence with direct access to the Weave. The confluence appears as a 30-foot-high, 10-foot-wide cylinder hovering slightly off the ground at a point you can see within range.
The confluence radiates a magical aura in a radius of up to 100 feet. You can use an action while within 5 feet of the confluence to increase or decrease the aura's radius.

While within the confluence's aura, spells cast cannot be countered, dispelled, or suppressed by any means. Spells cast within the aura are also treated as if they were cast using a spell slot two levels higher.

entries.name: Ability Score Increase
entries: Increase one ability score by 2 and another ability score by 1.

entries.name: Age
entries: Beastfolk age as humans do.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Beastfolk are true to their own hearts more than any law or code of ethics making them more often than not chaotic. They tend towards neutral more than evil or good.

entries.name: Size
entries: Beastfolk are Medium. The Small but Mighty breed trait can change your size to Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Wild and Free
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and a special language, Beastspeech. Beastspeech can only be learned by Beastfolk and, when speaking it, you can communicate with animals as if under the effect of the {@spell speak with animals} spell.

entries.name: All Creatures Under the Sun
entries: You gain 2 breed traits based on the animal you share an appearance with. You choose from the traits below. The Small but Mighty trait grants you an additional trait choice.

entries.name: Adept Climber
entries: You gain proficiency in your choice of the {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics} skill. You have a climb speed of 30 feet.

entries.name: Burrowing
entries: While you have two free hands you have a burrowing speed of 25 feet.

entries.name: Echolocation
entries: As a bonus action you can emit a shriek inaudible to most humanoids. Until the end of your next turn you have {@sense blindsight} up to 30 feet away.

entries.name: High Flyer
entries: You have a fly speed of 30 feet. You cannot fly when you are carrying more than half of your encumbrance rating in weight. While flying you make attack rolls and ability checks at disadvantage, cannot maintain {@status concentration} on spells, and cannot cast spells.

entries.name: Jumper
entries: You gain proficiency in your choice of the {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics} skill. Your jump distance is doubled.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill and choose one sense. You gain advantage on {@skill Perception} rolls that utilize that sense.

entries.name: Kin to Beasts
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Animal Handling} skill, and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this proficiency.

entries.name: Longstrider
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 40 feet.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: When you are struck by an attack, you can use your reaction to interpose your chitinous exoskeleton or other defensive feature between you and your attacker, giving you a +2 bonus to AC against that attack.

entries.name: Natural Talent
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice related to the animal you appear as.

entries.name: Natural Weapon
entries: You have a natural weapon that you are proficient in. This could be a bite, claw, quill, club tail, or other bestial feature. You can use your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. On a hit, you deal {@damage 1d4} + your modifier damage. You choose the damage type when you take this trait: bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.

entries.name: Nocturnal
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Scalekin
entries: You have a swim speed of 30 feet and can breathe both air and water.

entries.name: Small but Mighty
entries: Increase any ability score that has not already received an ability score increase by 1. You gain an additional breed trait from this list. Your size becomes Small.
